summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 12, 2019. It includes a count sheet, an out-count form, an inmate roster, and multiple official count slips, all related to the routine inmate population management and headcount procedures at the facility on that date.

events.title: Daily inmate count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine administrative headcount of inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, showing a total census of 757 inmates verified across multiple housing units.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC.
The forms show routine prison administrative procedures (inmate counts, rosters) were being conducted.
The total inmate census recorded was 757, verified across housing units B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, and Z-B.
An inmate roster includes assignments for 'HOSP' (hospital) and categories marked 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG', which may relate to protocols following an inmate death.
The documents are official Bureau of Prisons forms, indicating standard operational paperwork was generated on the date following Epstein's death.
